Method Detail

readAvroEntity

public static <T> T readAvroEntity(byte[] bytes,
                                   DatumReader<T> reader)
Given a byte array and a DatumReader, decode an avro entity from the byte array. Decodes using the avro BinaryDecoder. Return the constructed entity.

Parameters:
bytes - The byte array to decode the entity from.
reader - The DatumReader that will decode the byte array.
Returns:
The Avro entity.

readAvroEntity

public static <T> T readAvroEntity(Decoder decoder,
                                   DatumReader<T> reader)
Decode an entity from the initialized Avro Decoder using the DatumReader.

Parameters:
decoder - The decoder to decode the entity fields
reader - The Avro DatumReader that will read the entity with the decoder.
Returns:
The entity.

writeAvroEntity

public static <T> byte[] writeAvroEntity(T entity,
                                         DatumWriter<T> writer)
Given an entity and a DatumReader, encode the avro entity to a byte array. Encodes using the avro BinaryEncoder. Return the serialized bytes.

Parameters:
entity - The entity we want to encode.
writer - The DatumWriter we'll use to encode the entity to a byte array
Returns:
The avro entity encoded in a byte array.

writeAvroEntity

public static <T> void writeAvroEntity(T entity,
                                       Encoder encoder,
                                       DatumWriter<T> writer)
Given an entity, an avro schema, and an encoder, write the entity to the encoder's underlying output stream.

Parameters:
entity - The entity we want to encode.
encoder - The Avro Encoder we will write to.
writer - The DatumWriter we'll use to encode the entity to the encoder.

Given an avro Schema.Field instance, make a clone of it.

Parameters:

Returns:
The cloned field.

Convert an InputStream to a string encoded as UTF-8.

Parameters:
in - The InputStream to read the schema from.
